title: Are there any examples where robots replaced humans and failed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tesla’s brand new factory. They spent a fortune trying to replace people for complex assembly and packing tasks and found it cost more than hiring people to do that work. And while people can be reassigned or retrained, millions in logistical equipment is almost as expensive to move and calibrate again.

Chernobyl. The world’s most advanced robots were deployed to carry out critical tasks in the radiation zone. The didn’t achieve anything, leaving it to volunteers willing to take the near lethal radiation to get it done. Sarcastically they called themselves ‘biorobots’.
There was that case last year of the hamburger flipping robot that worked so fast that the humans couldn’t keep up and it had to be unplugged.
